Class ServerSocketFactory

java.lang.Object
com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.client.ServerSocketFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
SocksServerSocketFactory
public abstract class ServerSocketFactory extends Object
A factory that creates ServerSockets.

  • Method Details

    • getDefault

      public static ServerSocketFactory getDefault()
      Returns the default instance of ServerSocketFactory. The default instance creates plain ServerSockets.
      Returns:
      the default instance of ServerSocketFactory

    • getInstance

      public static ServerSocketFactory getInstance()
      Returns a ServerSocketFactory. If the system property socksClient.socksServerUri is set and the value is valid, a new SocksServerSocketFactory is returned. Otherwise, the default instance of ServerSocketFactory from getDefault() is returned.
      Returns:
      a ServerSocketFactory

    • newServerSocket

      public abstract ServerSocket newServerSocket() throws IOException
      Returns a new unbound ServerSocket.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket().

      Returns:
      a new unbound ServerSocket
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newServerSocket

      public abstract ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port) throws IOException
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to 50. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int).

      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newServerSocket

      public abstract ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port, int backlog) throws IOException
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int, int).

      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      backlog - the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket

    • newServerSocket

      public abstract ServerSocket newServerSocket(int port, int backlog, InetAddress bindAddr) throws IOException
      Returns a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections.

      The provided local port must be between 0 and 65535 inclusive. A provided local port of 0 will let the system pick up an available port. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided local port is less than 0 or greater than 65535.

      The maximum length of the queue of incoming connections is set to the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections. If an incoming connection indication (a request to connect) arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused. However, the exact semantics are implementation specific. In particular, an implementation may impose a maximum length or may choose to ignore the maximum length altogether. The value provided should be greater than 0. If it is less than or equal to 0, then an implementation specific default will be used.

      The provided local InetAddress can be used on a multi-homed host for a ServerSocket that will only accept connect requests to one of its addresses. If the provided local InetAddress is null, it will default accepting connections on any/all local addresses.

      Documentation is based from ServerSocket(int, int, InetAddress).

      Parameters:
      port - the provided local port
      backlog - the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      bindAddr - the provided local InetAddress (can be null)
      Returns:
      a new ServerSocket bound to the provided local port and the provided local InetAddress with the provided maximum length of the queue of incoming connections
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs in opening the ServerSocket
